These filters above were generated by the ICA code. They represent receptive field filters our brains would produce if they had evolved to use efficient coding algorithms to process this type of image.
Efficient coding is a term from Neuroscience that refers to the process that the brain does in order to transmit sensory information with the minimum amount of neurons firing as possible.
Our brains have evolved to use efficient coding algorithms specifically to process natural images and sounds, which include animal vocalizations, environmental sounds and human speech.
Efficient coding can be experimentally measured and displayed via images and waves called receptive field filters.
Using this app, you can see the receptive field filters associated to predefined images and sounds that look the same to the ones that can be seen in your brain!
